item.title: Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

Date: January 4, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Flight and train operations have been severely impacted in Delhi due to dense fog, leading to flight diversions and delays.

  • Normal operations have resumed at Delhi airport after interruptions.
  • A total of 19 flights were diverted due to adverse weather conditions early Saturday.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported temporary halts in operations due to extremely low visibility.
  • 81 trains were delayed at New Delhi station also owing to the fog.
  • Cold wave conditions affected several regions, including Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
“Due to adverse weather conditions in Delhi, 19 flight diversions were reported between 0015 hours and 0130 hours. Operations have now returned to normal.” - Delhi International Airport Limited

The recovery of operations signifies a return to normalcy at Delhi airport, but the impact of the weather has disrupted travel significantly.

item.title: Prasidh Krishna provides major update on Jasprit Bumrah's two-and-half-hour absence at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Prasidh Krishna Updates on Jasprit Bumrah's Injury at SCG

Date: Saturday, Source: Times of India

India pacer Prasidh Krishna provided an update about Jasprit Bumrah, who left the field due to a back spasm during the fifth Test at SCG. Bumrah's absence raised concerns but was later alleviated ahead of Australia's innings.

  • Bumrah left the field after bowling just one over.
  • Krishna claimed three wickets and helped bowl Australia out for 181.
  • Medical team is monitoring Bumrah's condition after scans.
  • In Bumrah's absence, Virat Kohli led the team.
"Bumrah had a back spasm. He went for scans, and the medical team is monitoring him. We will know more once the medical team gets back to us." - Prasidh Krishna

The Indian team is hopeful for Bumrah's quick recovery as they look forward to continuing their strong performance in the series.

item.title: Delhi Assembly elections 2025: BJP releases first list of 29 candiates - The Hindu
item.description:
BJP Unveils First List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

Date: January 04, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The BJP released a list of 29 candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections scheduled for February 2025, featuring significant matchups such as Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma against Arvind Kejriwal and Ramesh Bidhuri against Atishi.

  • The candidates include Vijender Gupta (Rohini), Ashish Sood (Janakpuri), and Kailash Gahlot (Bijwasan).
  • Ramesh Bidhuri will contest in Kalkaji against Delhi CM Atishi.
  • Dushyant Kumar Gautam is fielded from Karol Bagh (SC).
  • Sardar Tarvinder Singh Marwah will run against Manish Sisodia in Jangpura.
“BJP’s Ramesh Bidhuri will be contesting from Kalkaji constituency against AAP leader and Delhi Chief Minister Atishi.”

The initiative by the BJP to announce its candidate list sets the stage for fierce political battles in the upcoming elections.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal's 'Congress-BJP' Allies Charge Amid Protest By Punjab Women - NDTV
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses Congress and BJP of Collusion Amid Protests

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Amid protests led by women from Punjab outside his residence, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal launched a scathing attack on the Congress and BJP, accusing them of working in alliance to oppose his party.

  • Kejriwal stated that the protesting women are affiliates of Congress and BJP, not supporters from Punjab.
  • He claimed that AAP's governance model reliably delivers on its promises, citing free water supply to over 12 lakh families in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal announced a halt to payments for erroneous water bills, promising correction after upcoming elections.
  • Women from Punjab accused AAP of failing to deliver on the Rs 1,000 monthly stipend commitment.
  • Congress criticized AAP, claiming it would mislead women in Delhi just as it did in Punjab.
  • The controversy surrounding AAP's Mahila Samman Yojana intensified due to allegations of unauthorized data collection.
  • BJP announced its first list of candidates for the 2025 Delhi assembly elections.
“Is he scared? The people of Delhi aren't fools. The people will give him an answer in the elections.” - Congress leader Pawan Khera

This situation reflects ongoing political tensions in Delhi, especially as the assembly elections approach, highlighting the competition between AAP, Congress, and BJP.

item.title: Is it safe to travel to China amid HMPV outbreak scare and viral videos? All you need to know - The Economic Times
item.description:
Is it safe to travel to China amid HMPV outbreak scare and viral videos? All you need to know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

China faces a fresh outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), raising concerns similar to the Covid-19 pandemic. This article discusses the current situation, travel safety, and responses from authorities.

Key Points:

  • There is a reported rise in HMPV cases in China, accompanied by videos showing overcrowded hospitals.
  • China insists it is safe for travelers, despite conflicting reports on the severity of the outbreak.
  • The HMPV virus shares symptoms with other respiratory illnesses, complicating the situation.
  • Indian authorities are monitoring the situation but report no alarming spikes in respiratory illnesses.
“Respiratory infections tend to peak during the winter season... The diseases appear to be less severe and spread on a smaller scale compared to the previous year.” - Mao Ning, Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson

This situation highlights the importance of monitoring health crises and the protocols for safely traveling during outbreaks.

item.title: Sheet masks are perfect for today's busy lifestyle, says Jung Ji-woo | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Jung Ji-woo's Neaf Neaf: A New Arrival in India’s K-Beauty Scene

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Mint

South Korean beauty entrepreneur Jung Ji-woo launches her brand Neaf Neaf in India, aiming to cater to the growing K-beauty market among Indian consumers.

  • Neaf Neaf was launched at the Kosmos festival in Delhi.
  • The brand focuses on plant-derived ingredients and will feature a PDRN product range.
  • Jung Ji-woo discusses her motivations and insights into the Indian beauty market.
"The Korean beauty industry is trying to expand its presence in India."

This initiative is part of a broader trend of increasing K-beauty influence in India, meeting local consumer demands.

item.title: BJP releases first list for Delhi Assembly polls, ex-MP Parvesh Verma to take on Arvind Kejriwal - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP Releases First List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Indian Express

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has announced its first list of 29 candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, scheduled for February 2025.

  • Former MP Parvesh Verma will contest against AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal in New Delhi.
  • Ramesh Bidhuri is set to face CM Atishi from Kalkaji.
  • Kailash Gahlot will be contesting from Bijwasan instead of his usual Najafgarh.
  • Anil Bajpayee has been dropped in favor of former Congress chief Arvinder Singh Lovely.
  • Speculation surrounds a potential leadership change in the BJP's Delhi unit ahead of the elections.
  • AAP has announced candidates for all 70 constituencies, while Congress has named candidates for 21 seats.
“Lack of options” on certain seats caused a delay in announcing candidates.

This initial candidate list is a significant step in BJP's preparations for the elections, crucial for their strategies in Delhi.

item.title: Children on social media, breach notifications and more: The draft Data Protection Rules 2025 - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Children on social media, breach notifications and more: The draft Data Protection Rules 2025

Published on: 04 Jan 2025, 7:34 am

The draft Digital Personal Data Protection Rules, 2025, aim to protect children's personal data by requiring parental consent before processing. The government seeks feedback on the rules by February 18, 2025.

  • Social media platforms must obtain verifiable parental consent for processing children's data.
  • Data fiduciaries must confirm the guardian's identity before processing a child's data.
  • State entities can process personal data for providing subsidies and services, under certain conditions.
  • Data fiduciaries must implement reasonable security safeguards to protect personal data.
  • In case of data breaches, timely notification of affected individuals is required, including details on the breach and mitigation measures.
  • Personal data must be erased if not used for its intended purpose, promoting responsible data retention practices.
“C is a child, P is her parent, and DF is a Data Fiduciary. A user account of C is sought to be created on the online platform of DF, by processing the personal data of C.”

The implementation of these rules could significantly enhance the protection of children's data in the digital space while ensuring accountability among data fiduciaries.

item.title: 6 healthiest reasons to drink haldi shot every morning - The Times of India
item.description:
6 Healthiest Reasons to Drink Haldi Shot Every Morning

Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

Consuming a haldi shot every morning has numerous health benefits that can improve overall well-being.

  • Boosts immunity and fights infections.
  • Improves digestion and gut health.
  • Acts as a natural anti-inflammatory agent.
  • Supports liver health and detoxification.
  • Enhances skin health and radiance.
  • May aid in weight loss and metabolic functions.
“Incorporating haldi shots into your daily routine can be a game-changer for your health.”

Incorporating haldi shots daily can offer a multitude of health benefits, making it a simple yet effective step towards better health.

item.title: US Surgeon General bats for cancer warnings on alcohol: Here's how it causes breast cancer - CNBCTV18
item.description:
US Surgeon General Calls for Warning Labels on Alcohol Due to Cancer Risks

Publication Date: Friday | Source: CNBC

US Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy has issued an advisory labeling alcohol as a leading preventable cause of cancer and recommending warning labels on alcoholic beverages.

Dr. Murthy highlighted that alcohol is responsible for approximately 100,000 cancer cases and 20,000 deaths annually in the US, exceeding fatalities from alcohol-related traffic incidents. He noted that alcohol is the third leading preventable cancer cause after tobacco and obesity.

  • Alcohol consumption is linked to breast cancer and is a significant modifiable risk factor.
  • The WHO reported that breast cancer diagnoses are escalating, with 1,579 cases daily in their European region.
  • In 2020, alcohol contributed to nearly 40,000 new breast cancer cases in the WHO European Region.
  • Dr. Marilys Corbex emphasized the need for public awareness regarding alcohol's role in breast cancer.
“Many people, including women, are not aware that breast cancer is the most common cancer caused by alcohol among women globally. By reducing alcohol consumption, they can reduce their risk of getting cancer.” – Dr. Marilys Corbex

WHO has classified alcohol as a Group 1 human carcinogen, linked to several cancers, and advises that there is no safe level of consumption.

The Surgeon General's proposal may face legislative hurdles amid opposition from the alcohol industry.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Rishabh Pant's blistering 29-ball half-century drove India to a 145-run lead despite their batting struggles, as they ended the second day at 141 for 6.

  • India ended Day 2 at 141/6, leading Australia by 145 runs after Australia was bowled out for 181.
  • Rishabh Pant scored a quick 50 runs off just 29 balls, showcasing aggressive batting.
  • Jasprit Bumrah returned to the stadium after injury concerns, boosting India's hopes.
  • Scott Boland took crucial wickets for Australia, including Virat Kohli and KL Rahul.
  • The match stakes are high: India aims to qualify for the World Test Championship finals.
“We need a partnership to stretch the lead past 200,” noted an expert on India's performance.

As the match progresses, both teams will be eager to capitalize on their advantages as they battle for crucial points in this tightly contested series.

item.title: HMPV outbreak: Common symptoms seen in kids and adults - The Times of India
item.description:
HMPV outbreak: Common symptoms seen in kids and adults

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak is raising global concerns regarding its transmission and symptoms.

  • HMPV is being monitored closely in China and other countries.
  • It is prevalent among children aged 14 and under, especially in hospital visits.
  • Common symptoms include cough, fever, nasal congestion, and shortness of breath.
  • Severe cases can lead to bronchitis and pneumonia.
  • HMPV spreads through respiratory droplets from infected individuals.
  • Good hygiene practices are essential for prevention.
  • HMPV is responsible for about 20,000 hospitalizations among children under 5 in the U.S. annually.
“Currently, there is no vaccine against HMPV.”

In conclusion, staying informed and practicing hygiene precautions can help mitigate the spread of HMPV.

item.title: IND vs AUS 5th Test Live Score: Cummins ends Rishabh Pant's sparkling thrill-a-minute knock; India 5 down - India TV News
item.description:
IND vs AUS 5th Test Live Score: India's lead reaches 145 after Pant blitz but suspense over Bumrah continues

Date: January 4, 2025 | Source: India TV News

On the second day of the 5th Test, India has established a 145-run lead following a stellar performance by Rishabh Pant, despite concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's fitness. India needs to capitalize on their lead to secure a critical victory in the series.

  • India was bowled out for 185, with Rishabh Pant scoring a quick 61 runs off 33 balls.
  • Scott Boland took several wickets, continuing to apply pressure on the Indian batting lineup.
  • Jasprit Bumrah has left the field due to possible injury, causing concerns for the Indian bowling attack.
  • Australia trails by 84 runs with five wickets in hand as they respond to India's first innings score.
  • Rohit Sharma opted to sit out this Test, stating he needed to improve his batting form.
“This decision is not a retirement call, neither I'm stepping away. But I sat out of this game because I have not been scoring runs.” - Rohit Sharma

India must maintain their focus and capitalize on their lead, especially with Bumrah's uncertain status impacting their strategy for the remainder of the match.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah returns to Sydney Cricket Ground after hospital visit - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Returns to Sydney Cricket Ground After Hospital Visit

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah made a concerning exit from the SCG during the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy but has since returned after a visit to the hospital.

  • Bumrah left the field with the team doctor after bowling just one over post-Lunch.
  • He previously took the important wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, bringing his series total to 32 wickets.
  • The record, set on Australian soil, surpasses the previous record of 31 wickets held by Bishan Singh Bedi.
  • Bumrah's timely return is crucial as he has been pivotal to the team's performance this series.
Throughout his spell, Bumrah maintained decent speeds and consistently clocked over 135 kmph with no visible discomfort.

Team India hopes that Bumrah's minor issue is not serious, as his availability is essential for the remainder of the match.

item.title: Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration - The Hindu
item.description:
Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration

Date: January 04, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Madhya Pradesh police have filed five cases against protesters who opposed the disposal of toxic waste linked to the Bhopal gas tragedy, leading to significant unrest in Pithampur.

  • Protests erupted after 337 tonnes of toxic waste reached the Ramky Enviro company.
  • The police enforced prohibitory orders banning public gatherings around Ramky Enviro.
  • Five separate cases were registered for public disorder.
  • Two individuals attempted self-immolation during the protests but were saved safely.
  • The Chief Minister assured public safety and adherence to judicial directives regarding waste disposal.
“The state government only transported the Union Carbide waste with safety parameters in compliance with the Supreme Court's instructions.” - Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

The situation has returned to normal, with all industrial operations functioning after the protests subsided. Authorities are awaiting further court orders regarding the disposal of the waste.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah is back in the Indian dressing room, IND 97/4 vs AUS in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2

Publication Date: Saturday
Source: Indian Express

On Day 2 of the 5th Test in Sydney, India is in a challenging position with 124 runs for 5 wickets, while Australia had taken a slight lead of 181 runs at Tea. Notable performances include Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna taking three wickets each, and Jasprit Bumrah’s hospital visit after a bowling incident.

  • India scored 185 in their first innings.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna took three wickets each to restrict Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah sent to the hospital for scans after his bowling outing.
  • Rishabh Pant has departed during the ongoing match.
  • Match is live at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
“India could not put on a better top-order display despite replacing their out-of-form skipper Rohit Sharma.”

As the match progresses, Australia's steadiness with a lead suggests a riveting contest ahead as India needs to regroup to stay competitive.

item.title: Anant Ambani pledges unwavering commitment to Jamnagar and Vantara at Jamnagar Refinery's 25th anniversar - The Times of India
item.description:
Anant Ambani's Commitment to Jamnagar and Vantara at 25th Anniversary of Jamnagar Refinery

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

During the 25th anniversary celebration of the Jamnagar Refinery, Anant Ambani reaffirmed his commitment to Jamnagar and the Vantara conservation initiative.

  • Anant Ambani highlighted the importance of Jamnagar as a city of service and a cornerstone of Reliance's legacy.
  • He acknowledged the foundational role of his grandfather, Dhirubhai Ambani, in the success of Jamnagar.
  • Vantara, a significant conservation initiative, aims to embody Reliance's commitment to sustainability.
  • The project includes various sanctuaries contributing to biodiversity and ecological harmony.
  • Anant emphasized making Vantara a global model for conservation.
  • He expressed gratitude for the support of employees and the community in Reliance’s endeavors.
Anant Ambani expressed gratitude and a forward-looking vision for Jamnagar's growth and ecological responsibility.

This celebration marked a pivotal moment for Reliance as it continues to innovate while prioritizing sustainability in its corporate narrative.
